intro: Tillandsia lindenii var. genuina, commonly known as the silver pine tillandsia, is a species of air plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white trichomes. These trichomes help the plant absorb moisture and nutrients from the air, allowing it to thrive in humid environments. The plant produces striking inflorescences with showy, violet-colored flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening and terrariums.
